docs.title: MemoWiki
docs.text:
A persistent memory layer and agent for your codebase.

  • Turn your repository into a long‑term memory store
  • Run an API server for your own tools and dashboards
  • Get semantic search over your code via ChromaDB
  • Generate summaries, intent analysis, and more

docs.title: Install
docs.text:
npm install -g memowiki

Or run on demand:

npx memowiki@latest --help

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Configure environment
  2. Create a .env in your project

  3. Set at least:

    bash LLM_PROVIDER=openai OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-... ENABLE_SEMANTIC_SEARCH=true CHROMA_URL=http://localhost:8000

  4. Start ChromaDB (local vector DB)

  5. Run an initial update from your project root:
memowiki update --full

This scans your code, talks to the LLM, and writes structured summaries into .codewiki/.

docs.title: Core Commands
docs.text:
See the detailed pages in the sidebar for examples.

  • memowiki update – scan code and refresh the wiki
  • memowiki search – semantic search over your code
  • memowiki summaries – query stored implementation summaries
  • memowiki serve – start the Agent API + dashboard backend
  • memowiki analyze – git insights
  • memowiki record – manually record an implementation summary
  • memowiki intent – explain the intent of your current changes

docs.title: Dashboard
docs.text:
Run the Agent API server and open the dashboard:

memowiki serve -p 3000
# then open http://localhost:3000

The dashboard shows:

  • Recent activity and scans
  • File‑level summaries and status
  • Semantic search results (when enabled)
  • LLM configuration controls

docs.text:

  • CLI Usage: each command has its own page under CLI Commands.
  • Dashboard: screenshots and flows on the Dashboard page.

For full details, browse the rest of the docs in the sidebar.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The analyze command provides insights into your git repository, showing recent activity, file changes, branch status, and potential merge conflicts.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: memowiki analyze

docs.title: No Options
docs.text: This command has no options. It always displays complete repository status.

docs.title: 1. Repository Status
docs.text:
=== Repository Status ===
Modified files: 5
Created files: 2
Deleted files: 1

Shows current working directory changes.

docs.title: 2. Recent Commit
docs.text:
=== Recent Commit ===
Message: feat: add authentication
Author: John Doe
Date: 2025-12-02T10:30:00Z

Most recent commit information.

docs.title: 3. Branch Information
docs.text:
=== Branch Information ===
Current Branch: feature/auth
Upstream: origin/feature/auth
Ahead: 2 / Behind: 0

Branch tracking and sync status.

docs.title: 4. Merge Conflicts (if any)
docs.text:
⚠️  Merge Conflicts Detected:
  - src/auth/login.ts
  - src/auth/middleware.ts

Files with merge conflicts.

docs.title: Basic Analysis
docs.text:
memowiki analyze

Full output:

📊 Analyzing git repository...

=== Repository Status ===
Modified files: 3
Created files: 1
Deleted files: 0

=== Recent Commit ===
Message: feat: implement login flow
Author: Alice Developer
Date: 2025-12-02T09:15:30Z

=== Branch Information ===
Current Branch: main
Upstream: origin/main
Ahead: 0 / Behind: 0

✨ Analysis complete!

docs.title: Pre-Commit Check
docs.text:
# Check status before committing
memowiki analyze

# Shows what will be documented
memowiki update

docs.title: Code Review Prep
docs.text:
# See what changed
memowiki analyze

# Generate docs for review
memowiki update
memowiki record --type feature

docs.title: Merge Conflict Detection
docs.text:
# Check for conflicts
memowiki analyze

# Shows files needing resolution

docs.title: Branch Sync Status
docs.text:
# Check if branch is up to date
memowiki analyze

# Shows ahead/behind count

docs.title: Programmatic Access
docs.text:
import { GitService } from 'memowiki';

const gitService = new GitService();

// Check if git repo
const isRepo = await gitService.isRepo();

// Get full status
const gitState = await gitService.getGitState();

console.log('Modified:', gitState.status.modified);
console.log('Branch:', gitState.branch.current);
console.log('Conflicts:', gitState.conflicts);

docs.title: Git State Object
docs.text:
interface GitState {
  status: {
    modified: string[];
    created: string[];
    deleted: string[];
    renamed: string[];
  };
  branch: {
    current: string;
    upstream?: string;
    ahead: number;
    behind: number;
  };
  recentCommit?: {
    hash: string;
    message: string;
    author_name: string;
    author_email: string;
    date: string;
  };
  conflicts: string[];
}

docs.title: Pre-Commit Hook
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# .git/hooks/pre-commit

echo "Analyzing repository..."
memowiki analyze

if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
  echo "Git analysis failed"
  exit 1
fi

docs.title: CI Pipeline
docs.text:
# .github/workflows/docs.yml
- name: Analyze repository
  run: memowiki analyze

- name: Generate docs for changes
  run: memowiki update

docs.title: Not a Git Repository
docs.text:
❌ Not a git repository.

Solution:

git init

docs.title: No Upstream Branch
docs.text:
Current Branch: feature/new
Upstream: (none)
Ahead: 0 / Behind: 0

Solution:

git push -u origin feature/new

docs.title: Outdated Branch
docs.text:
Ahead: 0 / Behind: 5

Solution:

git pull origin main

docs.title: Related Commands
docs.text:
The analyze command complements:

Update - Uses git status to detect modified files

memowiki analyze  # See what changed
memowiki update   # Generate docs for changes

Record - Uses git to auto-detect files for summary

memowiki analyze              # Check current changes
memowiki record --type feature  # Auto-detects files

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
• Fast execution (~10-50ms)
  • No API calls required
  • Reads git metadata locally
  • Minimal resource usage

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• Update Command - Uses git status
  • Record Command - Auto-detects files from git

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: MemoWiki supports multiple LLM providers for generating documentation. Configure your preferred provider using environment variables.

docs.title: OpenAI
docs.text:
LLM_PROVIDER=openai
OPENAI_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
OPENAI_MODEL=gpt-4-turbo-preview  # Default

Supported Models: - gpt-4-turbo-preview - gpt-4 - gpt-3.5-turbo

docs.title: Anthropic (Claude)
docs.text:
LLM_PROVIDER=anthropic
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
ANTHROPIC_MODEL=claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022  # Default

Supported Models: - claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022 - claude-3-opus-20240229 - claude-3-sonnet-20240229

docs.title: Google Gemini
docs.text:
LLM_PROVIDER=gemini
GEMINI_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
GEMINI_MODEL=gemini-1.5-pro  # Default

Supported Models: - gemini-1.5-pro - gemini-1.5-flash - gemini-pro

docs.title: OpenRouter
docs.text:
LLM_PROVIDER=openrouter
OPENROUTER_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
OPENROUTER_MODEL=anthropic/claude-3.5-sonnet  # Default

Supported Models: - Any model available on OpenRouter - See https://openrouter.ai/models for full list

docs.title: Ollama (Local)
docs.text:
LLM_PROVIDER=ollama
OLLAMA_BASE_URL=http://localhost:11434  # Default
OLLAMA_MODEL=llama2  # Default

Requirements: - Ollama running locally or remotely - Model pulled: ollama pull llama2

docs.title: Mock (Testing)
docs.text:
LLM_PROVIDER=mock

Returns placeholder content for testing without API calls.

docs.title: Semantic Search (Optional)
docs.text:
ENABLE_SEMANTIC_SEARCH=true
CHROMA_URL=http://localhost:8000  # Default

Requirements: - ChromaDB instance running - Used for memowiki search command

docs.title: Retry Configuration
docs.text:
MAX_RETRIES=3  # Default
RETRY_DELAY=1000  # Default (milliseconds)

docs.title: Environment File
docs.text:
Create a .env file in your project root:

# .env
LLM_PROVIDER=openai
OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-...
OPENAI_MODEL=gpt-4-turbo-preview

ENABLE_SEMANTIC_SEARCH=false
MAX_RETRIES=3
RETRY_DELAY=1000

docs.title: Programmatic Configuration
docs.text:
import { ConfigManager } from 'memowiki';

const configManager = new ConfigManager({
  provider: 'openai',
  openaiApiKey: 'sk-...',
  openaiModel: 'gpt-4-turbo-preview',
  maxRetries: 3,
  retryDelay: 1000
});

const config = configManager.getConfig();

docs.title: Validation
docs.text: MemoWiki validates configuration on startup: - ✅ API keys required for cloud providers - ✅ Model names validated - ✅ Connection tested (optional)

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Use environment variables for API keys (never commit to git)
  2. Start with mock provider for testing
  3. Use Ollama for local development
  4. Use cloud providers for production quality
  5. Configure retry settings based on provider reliability

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The MemoWiki Dashboard is a web-based interface for visualizing and managing your codebase documentation. Built with Angular 21, it provides real-time insights into your documentation status, agent activity, and LLM configuration.

docs.title: Overview Dashboard
docs.text:
• Statistics Cards: Quick view of documented files, cache hit rate, summaries created, and pending TODOs
  • Activity Feed: Recent documentation updates, summaries, and git synchronization events
  • Quick Actions: Navigate to key features with one click

docs.title: Documentation Browser
docs.text:
• File List: View all files with their documentation status
  • Status Filters: Filter by documented, stale, or missing documentation
  • Search: Quick search through file paths
  • Cache Indicators: See which files have cached documentation

docs.title: Summaries Timeline
docs.text:
• Chronological View: All agent implementation summaries in reverse chronological order
  • Type Filters: Filter by feature, bugfix, refactor, or other
  • Metadata: View files included, TODOs, and stub indicators for each summary
  • Search: Find specific summaries by title or description

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
• LLM Configuration: View current provider and model settings
  • Provider Status: See which providers are configured and connected
  • Usage Statistics: Monitor API requests and estimated costs (per provider)
  • Quick Switching: Change default provider (when implemented)

docs.title: Building the Dashboard
docs.text:
# Build backend and dashboard together
npm run build:all

# Or build dashboard only
npm run build:dashboard

docs.title: Running the Dashboard
docs.text:
# Production mode (serve compiled dashboard)
npm run build:all
memowiki serve
# Access at http://localhost:3000

docs.title: Development Mode
docs.text:
For dashboard development with hot-reload:

# Terminal 1: Start backend API
memowiki serve

# Terminal 2: Start dashboard dev server
cd dashboard
npm start
# Access at http://localhost:4200

The dev server proxies API requests to localhost:3000 via proxy.conf.json.

docs.title: Frontend Stack
docs.text:
• Framework: Angular 21 (standalone components)
  • UI Library: Angular Material
  • State Management: NgRx (planned for Phase 2)
  • Charts: Chart.js + ng2-charts (planned)
  • Markdown: ngx-markdown + marked
  • Diagrams: Mermaid (planned)

docs.title: Backend Integration
docs.text:
The dashboard communicates with the MemoWiki backend via REST API:

Endpoint Purpose GET /api/v1/stats/overview Overview statistics GET /api/v1/files/status File documentation status GET /api/v1/summaries Agent summaries list GET /api/v1/activity?days=7 Recent activity feed GET /api/v1/config/llm LLM configuration

docs.title: Monorepo Structure
docs.text:
The dashboard is configured as a workspace within the main MemoWiki project:

MemoWikiV1/
├── dashboard/              # Angular dashboard
│   ├── src/
│   │   ├── app/
│   │   │   ├── features/  # Main feature modules
│   │   │   ├── core/      # Services and models
│   │   │   └── shared/    # Reusable components
│   │   └── environments/
│   └── dist/              # Compiled output
├── src/                   # Backend TypeScript
├── node_modules/          # Shared dependencies
└── package.json           # Workspace configuration

# 2. Test with hot-reload

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The intent command analyzes your current code changes and determines the intent behind them. It classifies changes as bug fixes, features, refactors, etc., and provides actionable suggestions.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: memowiki intent

docs.title: No Options
docs.text: This command has no options. It analyzes all current uncommitted changes.

docs.title: 1. Change Detection
docs.text:
• Reads modified files from git status
  • Analyzes file patterns and content
  • Considers file types and naming conventions

docs.title: 2. Intent Classification
docs.text: Classifies changes into: - Bug Fix - Fixing existing issues - Feature - New functionality - Refactor - Code restructuring - Optimization - Performance improvements - Documentation - Doc updates only - Unknown - Unclear intent

docs.title: 3. Suggestion Generation
docs.text: Provides context-aware suggestions: - What to document - What tests to add - What to review

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
memowiki intent

Output:

🔍 Analyzing intent of current changes...

Intent: feature
Confidence: 85%
Summary: New feature affecting 3 files

Suggestions:
  1. Add documentation for new functionality
  2. Create tests for new features
  3. Update README if user-facing

docs.title: Different Intent Types
docs.text:
Bug Fix:

Intent: bug_fix
Confidence: 92%
Summary: Bug fix affecting 1 file

Suggestions:
  1. Add test cases to prevent regression
  2. Update documentation if behavior changed
  3. Consider adding error logging

Refactor:

Intent: refactor
Confidence: 78%
Summary: Code refactoring affecting 5 files

Suggestions:
  1. Ensure all tests still pass
  2. Update comments if needed
  3. Consider performance implications

Documentation:

Intent: documentation
Confidence: 100%
Summary: Documentation update affecting 1 file

Suggestions:
  1. Ensure examples are up to date
  2. Check for broken links

docs.title: Bug Fix
docs.text: Detected when: - Files contain .test. or .spec. - Commit messages mention "fix", "bug", "issue" - Small number of files changed - Defensive code patterns added

docs.title: Feature
docs.text: Detected when: - Multiple new files created - Significant code additions - New exports added - Schema/interface changes

docs.title: Refactor
docs.text: Detected when: - Code moved between files - Function/class renaming - No functional changes - Structure improvements

docs.title: Optimization
docs.text: Detected when: - Performance-related changes - Caching added - Algorithm improvements - Resource usage reduction

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text: Detected when: - Only .md files changed - Comment updates only - README modifications

docs.title: Confidence Scores
docs.text: Score Meaning Action 90-100% Very confident Trust classification 70-89% Confident Probably correct 50-69% Uncertain Verify intent 0-49% Low confidence Manual classification recommended

docs.title: Pre-Commit Review
docs.text:
# Check intent before committing
memowiki intent

# Verify suggestions
git diff

# Commit with appropriate message
git commit -m "feat: add authentication"

docs.title: Automated Documentation
docs.text:
# Analyze intent
INTENT=$(memowiki intent | grep "Intent:" | cut -d' ' -f2)

# Record appropriate summary
memowiki record --type $INTENT

docs.title: Code Review Prep
docs.text:
# Analyze changes
memowiki intent

# Generate documentation
memowiki update

# Create summary
memowiki record --type feature

docs.title: Programmatic Access
docs.text:
import { IntentAnalyzer } from 'memowiki';
import { configManager } from 'memowiki';

const config = configManager.getConfig();
const analyzer = new IntentAnalyzer(config);

const analysis = await analyzer.analyzeCurrentChanges();

console.log('Intent:', analysis.intent);
console.log('Confidence:', analysis.confidence);
console.log('Summary:', analysis.summary);
analysis.suggestions.forEach(s => console.log('-', s));

docs.title: Custom Intent Logic
docs.text:
// Override classification
class CustomAnalyzer extends IntentAnalyzer {
  protected classifyByPatterns(files: string[]): IntentType {
    // Custom rules
    if (files.some(f => f.includes('migration'))) {
      return IntentType.REFACTOR;
    }
    return super.classifyByPatterns(files);
  }
}

docs.title: Pre-Commit Hook
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# .git/hooks/pre-commit

echo "Analyzing commit intent..."
memowiki intent

read -p "Does this classification look correct? (y/n) " -n 1 -r
echo
if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
  exit 1
fi

docs.title: Commit Message Template
docs.text:
# Based on intent
INTENT=$(memowiki intent | grep "Intent:" | awk '{print $2}')

case $INTENT in
  "bug_fix")
    PREFIX="fix: "
    ;;
  "feature")
    PREFIX="feat: "
    ;;
  "refactor")
    PREFIX="refactor: "
    ;;
  *)
    PREFIX="chore: "
    ;;
esac

git commit -m "${PREFIX}your message here"

docs.title: LLM-Enhanced Analysis
docs.text: Future enhancement - use LLM to analyze: - Code diff content - Variable naming patterns - Comment changes - Import additions

docs.title: Multi-File Tracking
docs.text: Track intent across: - Related files - Module boundaries - Feature groupings

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
Current implementation uses pattern-based classification: - May misclassify complex changes - Doesn't understand code semantics - Limited to file-level patterns

Future LLM integration will improve: - Code-level understanding - Contextual analysis - Multi-file relationship tracking

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• Record Command - Create summaries based on intent
  • Analyze Command - Repository analysis
  • Update Command - Generate documentation

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The record command enables AI agents to save incremental implementation summaries. It tracks what was implemented, what was stubbed, and what remains as TODOs, creating a continuous documentation trail.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: memowiki record [options]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default -f, --files <files...> Files to include in summary Auto-detect from git -o, --output <name> Summary filename implementation-YYYY-MM-DD -t, --type <type> Summary type: feature|bugfix|refactor feature --append Append to existing summary false

docs.title: 1. File Detection
docs.text:
• Auto-detects modified/created files from git
  • Or accepts explicit file list via --files

docs.title: 2. Code Analysis
docs.text: Analyzes code for: - TODOs: Comments containing TODO, FIXME, XXX - Stubs: Empty functions, placeholder returns, unimplemented methods - Completed: Fully functional code

docs.title: 3. LLM Summary Generation
docs.text: Creates structured markdown with: 1. What Was Implemented - Fully functional features 2. What Was Stubbed - Placeholder/incomplete code 3. Outstanding TODOs - What still needs work 4. Integration Points - How this connects to the system 5. Next Steps - Suggested follow-up work

docs.title: 4. Index Management
docs.text: Updates .codewiki/summaries/index.json: - Summary ID - Timestamp - Type (feature/bugfix/refactor) - Files included - Summary path

docs.title: Basic Summary
docs.text:
memowiki record --files src/auth/*.ts --type feature --output auth-v1

Output:

📝 Generating summary for 2 files...
   🤖 [openai:gpt-4-turbo-preview] Generating Agent Summary...
✨ Saved summary to .codewiki/summaries/auth-v1.md

docs.title: Auto-Detect Files
docs.text:
memowiki record --type bugfix --output fix-login-bug

Uses git to find modified and created files.

docs.title: Append Mode
docs.text:
memowiki record --files src/auth/login.ts --append --output auth-v1

Adds to existing summary with timestamp separator:

# Previous content...

---

## Update: 2025-12-02T12:00:00.000Z

# New implementation summary...

docs.title: Multiple Summary Types
docs.text:
Feature implementation:

memowiki record --type feature --output user-profile

Bug fix:

memowiki record --type bugfix --output fix-auth-token

Refactoring:

memowiki record --type refactor --output cleanup-services

docs.title: Output Structure
docs.text:
.codewiki/summaries/
├── index.json                      # Central index
├── auth-v1.md                      # Feature summary
├── fix-login-bug.md                # Bugfix summary
└── cleanup-services.md             # Refactor summary

docs.title: Summary Format
docs.text:
# Feature: User Authentication

**Date**: 2025-12-02  
**Files**: src/auth/login.ts, src/auth/register.ts  
**Type**: Feature

## What Was Implemented
- User login with JWT authentication
- Password hashing with bcrypt
- Session management

## What Was Stubbed
- Password reset functionality (placeholder)
- OAuth integration (TODO)

## Outstanding TODOs
- [ ] Implement password reset email flow
- [ ] Add OAuth providers (Google, GitHub)
- [ ] Add rate limiting to login endpoint

## Integration Points
- Connects to `UserService` for user lookup
- Uses `TokenService` for JWT generation
- Integrates with `EmailService` (stubbed)

## Next Steps
1. Complete password reset flow
2. Add comprehensive tests
3. Implement OAuth

docs.title: Stub Detection Patterns
docs.text:
The command identifies these stub patterns:

Empty functions:

function placeholder() {
  // Empty
}

Literal returns:

function getData() {
  return null;  // Stub
}

Not implemented:

function process() {
  throw new Error('Not implemented');
}

Placeholder comments:

function handler() {
  // TODO: Implement this
}

docs.title: Querying Summaries
docs.text:
See summaries with the summaries command:

# Recent summaries
memowiki summaries --recent 5

# By file
memowiki summaries --file src/auth/login.ts

# By type
memowiki summaries --type feature

docs.title: For AI Agents
docs.text:
• Incremental documentation after each task
  • Work tracking for what's done vs stubbed
  • Context preservation for future agents
  • TODO management explicit list of follow-up work

docs.title: For Developers
docs.text:
• Implementation log chronological record
  • Reduced manual docs automatic generation
  • Better handoffs see implementation rationale
  • Quick lookups find what was implemented when

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Record after each task - Keep summaries focused
  2. Use descriptive names - Make summaries easy to find
  3. Choose correct type - feature/bugfix/refactor
  4. Use append mode - For ongoing work on same feature
  5. Review before committing - Ensure accuracy

docs.title: Integration with Workflow
docs.text:
Post-implementation workflow:

# 1. Make code changes
git add src/auth/*.ts

# 2. Record summary
memowiki record --type feature --output auth-implementation

# 3. Commit both code and docs
git commit -m "feat: add authentication"

CI/CD Integration:

# .github/workflows/docs.yml
- name: Record implementation
  run: memowiki record --type feature --output ci-${GITHUB_SHA}

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The search command provides semantic search across your codebase wiki using natural language queries. It leverages vector embeddings and similarity matching to find relevant code.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: memowiki search <query> [options]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default -n, --limit <number> Number of results to return 10

docs.title: ChromaDB Instance
docs.text:
# Using Docker
docker run -p 8000:8000 chromadb/chroma

# Or install locally
pip install chromadb
chroma run --host localhost --port 8000

docs.title: Enable in Configuration
docs.text:
ENABLE_SEMANTIC_SEARCH=true
CHROMA_URL=http://localhost:8000

docs.title: 1. Embedding Generation
docs.text:
• Code documentation converted to vector embeddings
  • Uses sentence transformers or OpenAI embeddings
  • Stored in ChromaDB vector database

docs.title: 2. Similarity Search
docs.text:
• Query converted to embedding
  • Cosine similarity with stored vectors
  • Returns top N most similar documents

docs.title: 3. Results Ranking
docs.text:
• Ranked by similarity score (0-100%)
  • Includes code metadata (type, file, name)
  • Shows snippet of matched content

docs.title: Basic Search
docs.text:
memowiki search "authentication with JWT"

Output:

🔍 Searching for: "authentication with JWT"

📊 Found 3 results:

1. [95.2%] src/auth/login.ts
   Function: authenticateUser
   Authenticates user credentials and generates JWT token for session management...

2. [87.3%] src/auth/middleware.ts
   Function: verifyToken
   Validates JWT tokens from Authorization header and extracts user claims...

3. [72.1%] src/types/auth.ts
   Interface: JWTPayload
   Defines structure of JWT token payload including user ID and expiration...

docs.title: Limited Results
docs.text:
memowiki search "database connection" --limit 5

Returns top 5 matches only.

docs.title: Complex Queries
docs.text:
Natural language:

memowiki search "how do we handle errors in API requests"

Technical terms:

memowiki search "React hooks for state management"

Code patterns:

memowiki search "async functions that return promises"

docs.title: Indexed Content
docs.text: The search indexes: - Function documentation - Purpose, parameters, returns - Class documentation - Overview, methods, properties - File summaries - High-level purpose and exports - Architecture notes - System design and patterns

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
Query speed: - Simple query: ~50-100ms - Complex query: ~100-200ms - Large codebase (1000+ files): ~200-500ms

Index size: - ~10KB per file - 100 files: ~1MB - 1000 files: ~10MB

docs.title: Use Natural Language
docs.text: ❌ Bad: jwt auth token ✅ Good: how do we authenticate users with JWT tokens

docs.title: Be Specific
docs.text: ❌ Bad: database ✅ Good: database connection pooling configuration

docs.title: Include Context
docs.text: ❌ Bad: error handling ✅ Good: error handling in GraphQL resolvers

docs.title: Programmatic Access
docs.text:
import { SearchService } from 'memowiki';

const searchService = new SearchService();
await searchService.initialize();

const results = await searchService.search('authentication', 10);

results.forEach(result => {
  console.log(`${result.similarity}% - ${result.id}`);
  console.log(result.content);
});

docs.title: Custom Filters
docs.text:
// Search within specific module
const authResults = results.filter(r => 
  r.metadata.file.startsWith('src/auth')
);

// Filter by code element type
const functions = results.filter(r => 
  r.metadata.type === 'function'
);

docs.title: No Results
docs.text:
No results found.

Possible causes: 1. Wiki not generated yet - run memowiki update 2. Query too specific - try broader terms 3. Content not indexed - check ChromaDB has data

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The serve command starts an HTTP API server that exposes MemoWiki functionality for external integrations. This enables IDEs, CI/CD pipelines, and other tools to access documentation programmatically.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: memowiki serve [options]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default -p, --port <number> Port to run server on 3000

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text: Starts an Express server with: - REST API endpoints: Documentation, search, summaries, health monitoring - Dashboard API: Overview stats, file statuses, activity feed, LLM config - Static File Serving: Serves the Angular dashboard web interface - SPA Routing: Handles client-side routing for the dashboard

docs.title: Default Port
docs.text:
memowiki serve

Output:

🚀 MemoWiki Agent API running on http://localhost:3000
   Health check: http://localhost:3000/health
   Dashboard: http://localhost:3000

Access the web dashboard at http://localhost:3000 or use the API at /api/v1/*.

docs.title: Custom Port
docs.text:
memowiki serve --port 8080

Starts server on port 8080.

docs.title: Background Process

nohup memowiki serve > server.log 2>&1 &

# Using pm2

// extension.ts
import * as vscode from 'vscode';

async function generateDocs(file: string) {

}));

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The summaries command queries agent implementation summaries created by the record command. It provides efficient filtering without parsing all summary files.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: memowiki summaries [options]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default -f, --file <file> Filter by file path - -t, --type <type> Filter by type (feature|bugfix|refactor) - -r, --recent <number> Get recent summaries 10

docs.title: Index-Based Retrieval
docs.text:
• Reads metadata from .codewiki/summaries/index.json
  • No need to parse all summary markdown files
  • Fast filtering on metadata only
  • Lazy loading of actual content

docs.title: Index Structure
docs.text:
{
  "entries": [
    {
      "id": "auth-implementation",
      "timestamp": 1733140000,
      "type": "feature",
      "files": ["src/auth/login.ts", "src/auth/register.ts"],
      "summaryPath": "summaries/auth-implementation.md"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Recent Summaries
docs.text:
memowiki summaries --recent 5

Output:

Found 5 summaries:

auth-implementation (2025-12-02)
Type: feature
Files: 2 files
Path: summaries/auth-implementation.md
---

fix-login-bug (2025-12-01)
Type: bugfix
Files: 1 files
Path: summaries/fix-login-bug.md
---

docs.title: Filter by File
docs.text:
memowiki summaries --file src/auth/login.ts

Shows all summaries that modified src/auth/login.ts.

docs.title: Filter by Type
docs.text:
memowiki summaries --type feature

Shows only feature implementation summaries.

docs.title: Combining with Other Commands
docs.text:
View specific summary:

# Find summaries
memowiki summaries --recent 3

# Read specific summary
cat .codewiki/summaries/auth-implementation.md

Filter and grep:

# Find summaries touching auth
memowiki summaries --file src/auth | grep -i "oauth"

docs.title: Output Format
docs.text: Each entry shows: - Summary ID - Unique identifier - Date - When summary was created - Type - feature, bugfix, or refactor - File Count - Number of files included - Path - Relative path to summary file

docs.title: Finding Related Work
docs.text:
# What was done in auth?
memowiki summaries --file src/auth

# What features were added recently?
memowiki summaries --type feature --recent 10

docs.title: Reviewing History
docs.text:
# What was done today?
memowiki summaries --recent 20 | grep $(date +%Y-%m-%d)

# What bugs were fixed?
memowiki summaries --type bugfix

docs.title: Agent Context
docs.text:
# What's the latest work on this file?
memowiki summaries --file src/services/payment.ts --recent 1

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
Fast queries - Index-based filtering: - 100 summaries: ~10ms - 1,000 summaries: ~50ms - 10,000 summaries: ~200ms

Lazy loading - Content only loaded when needed: - Listing summaries: reads index only - Viewing summary: reads specific file

docs.title: Programmatic Access
docs.text:
import { SummaryRetriever } from 'memowiki';

const retriever = new SummaryRetriever('.codewiki');

// Get recent
const recent = await retriever.getRecent(5);

// Get by file
const byFile = await retriever.getByFile('src/auth/login.ts');

// Get by type
const features = await retriever.getByType('feature');

docs.title: Custom Queries
docs.text:
// Complex filtering
const summaries = await retriever.getByFile('src/auth');
const bugfixes = summaries.filter(s => s.type === 'bugfix');
const recent = bugfixes.slice(0, 5);

docs.title: Rebuilding Index
docs.text:
If index gets corrupted:

# Delete index
rm .codewiki/summaries/index.json

# Re-record will recreate it
memowiki record --files src/**/*.ts

docs.title: Cleaning Old Summaries
docs.text:
# Find old summaries
memowiki summaries --recent 100

# Manual cleanup
rm .codewiki/summaries/old-summary.md

# Update index (re-record will fix it)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The update command scans your codebase, generates documentation using LLM, and creates visual diagrams. It intelligently tracks changes using git and caches results to avoid redundant API calls.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: memowiki update [options]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default --full Force full scan (ignore git diff) false --verbose Show detailed output false

docs.title: 1. File Discovery
docs.text:
• Detects modified files from git status
  • Or scans entire project with --full
  • Filters by supported extensions (.ts, .js, .tsx, .jsx)
  • Respects .memowikiignore file

docs.title: 2. Smart Caching
docs.text:
• Calculates content hash for each file
  • Checks cache for existing documentation
  • Only generates fresh docs for changed files
  • Significantly reduces API calls

docs.title: 3. Documentation Generation
docs.text:
• Parses code structure (classes, functions, imports)
  • Extracts git context (recent commits, authors)
  • Generates markdown documentation via LLM
  • Saves to .codewiki/memory/

docs.title: 4. Diagram Creation
docs.text:
• Creates class diagrams for each file
  • Generates architecture diagram for entire project
  • Saves to .codewiki/diagrams/ and .codewiki/flows/

docs.title: 5. Project Summary
docs.text:
• Analyzes all files together
  • Creates high-level project overview
  • Saves to .codewiki/summaries/project-overview.md

docs.title: Basic Update
docs.text:
memowiki update

Scans modified files and updates their documentation.

docs.title: Full Project Scan
docs.text:
memowiki update --full

Processes all files regardless of git status. Useful for: - Initial documentation generation - After major refactoring - When cache is stale

docs.title: Verbose Output
docs.text:
memowiki update --verbose

Shows detailed progress:

🚀 Starting MemoWiki update...
   Processing src/auth/login.ts...
   ♻️  Using cached data
   Processing src/auth/register.ts...
   🤖 [openai:gpt-4-turbo-preview] Generating documentation...
   📊 Generating project summary...
   📐 Generating architecture diagram...
✨ Documentation updated successfully!

docs.title: Output Structure
docs.text:
.codewiki/
├── memory/
│   ├── login.md                # Individual file docs
│   ├── register.md
│   └── ...
├── diagrams/
│   ├── login.md                # Class diagrams
│   ├── register.md
│   └── ...
├── flows/
│   └── architecture.md         # System architecture
└── summaries/
    └── project-overview.md     # High-level summary

docs.title: Cache Management
docs.text:
Cache stored in .codewiki/cache.json: - Content hash - Timestamp - LLM provider and model - Generated documentation and diagrams

Cache invalidated when: - File content changes - LLM provider changes - Model changes

docs.title: Performance Tips
docs.text:
1. Use --full sparingly - It processes all files
  2. Let git track changes - Default mode is much faster
  3. Configure retry settings - For flaky networks
  4. Use Ollama locally - No API rate limits

docs.title: Filtering Files
docs.text:
Create .memowikiignore in project root:

# Ignore test files
**/*.test.ts
**/*.spec.ts

# Ignore build output
dist/**
build/**

# Ignore specific directories
legacy/**
temp/**

docs.title: Integration with Git
docs.text: The update command respects your git workflow: - Modified files: Automatically detected - Staged files: Included in scan - Untracked files: Excluded by default - Ignored files: Always excluded

docs.title: Continuous Documentation
docs.text:
Recommended workflow: 1. Make code changes 2. Commit to git 3. Run memowiki update 4. Review generated docs 5. Commit documentation

Or use a git hook:

# .git/hooks/post-commit
#!/bin/bash
memowiki update --verbose

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
File not supported:

⚠️  Skipping unsupported file: config.json

Parse error:

⚠️  Failed to parse src/broken.ts: Unexpected token

LLM error:

⚠️  Failed to generate documentation (retrying...)

The command continues processing other files even if some fail.
